> <OLD>
>
> "Could be or not necesary, i dont know"replied Dryly PErceptor"That depends
> of the scan and the strategy to follow, My best bet is do the same what I
> did some weeks ago... Insolate the programs and install the other ones and
> partially unleash her memories; and speaking about her memories... If Kups
> observations are true then Her behavior could be a risk for herself and
> others; we couldnt afford sedate her again I dont know how much her health
> could stand it; If she Remembers you, you be able to calm her down enough to
> avoid any umpleasant situation cause she has strong emotional attachments
> with you and the other being that has stronger attachment is your Daughter
> and it's too young to put her in a risk... Speaking about risks, do you know
> if she still has my blaster? I gave her in one of the Maximals invations
> and she hadnt given it back"

Rodimus nodded, a worried but resolute look on his face as he walked
over to where Nightlight was laying, the scanning beam Bump and Legacy
were running was still moving slowly over her form. "She has been
through so much." He said quietly.

A part of him wanted to rage at Perceptor since it was he that did
much of this to her, yet he could not escape the stabs of guilt he
felt at his own hand in it.

"Her personality subroutines appear to be largely intact." Legacy said
as he watched the data from the scanning beam, "However many of them
are noncontiguous. They will need to be reorganized so that her
cerebral cortex can access them."

Bump nodded obviously in agreement, "Yes, but that will take some
time." He pointed to the screen, "Some of these have degraded over
time. They will need to be restored."

Rodimus reached out a hand to touch Nightlight, but stops just short,
not sure if his touch would disrupt the scanning field that enveloped
her. "Can you help her?"

Bump nodded gravely, "Yes I believe when can." He turned to look at
Perceptor, "If we can get some help reversing some of this damage."

Legacy remained silent, unwilling to venture a guess, there were far
too many variable for him to make an unqualified answer.

(TAG)

Preston
